item.description:
Sheepshearing Festival at Gore Place

Gore Place, the Federal period, historic house and estate of Massachusetts Governor Christopher Gore, includes a small farm with sheep, goats and poultry. The elegantly furnished mansion has been called “the Monticello of the North” and architectural historians consider it to be the most significant Federal period mansion in New England.  Maybe we will even get a tour of the house?

About the event:

Demonstrations of sheep-shearing, herding dogs, spinning, weaving, and more. Large crafts fair, live entertainment, wagon rides, pictures taken with the Santa Clause, historic demonstrators, games and farm animals, see the sheeps painting their toe nails and dancing in their tutu's, food vendors on site. Free parking.

Cost: adults, $15; children 12 and younger admitted free with an adult.

Parking:

There is parking at the event and additional parking on Gore Street.

Please remember that if you are running late, can’t find us or need to cancel at the last minute, the meetup phone number is:  978-304-2811.

Please remember that if you have not paid your dues for this year, be prepared to pay them at this event.  If you need to find out if you owe money, please look at your profile page where it states “Membership dues last recorded by your Organizer”, we thank you for paying your dues.

Remember to change your RSVP to an event if your plans change.  Also don’t forget after attending a meetup event to let your Organizers know if you had a good time by rating the meetup.

We look forward to shearing (get it) this event with you

Donna & Janet
item.how_to_find_us: Look for us by the entrance of the parking lot.
item.name: Sheep-shearing Festival
